This exhibition features work that reflects Armstrong’s interest in the way phenomena contrast and correlate. Working with mapping and memory, the pieces exhibited represent an accumulated mental reality of lived and dreamt experience, from the banal to the fantastic.

Referencing writing, comics, tattoo art, graffiti, and aboriginal Australian art, _Sprawling Array_ is an exhibition that acknowledges that the line between the cultural and the personal is not a sharp one, and perhaps does not exist at all.
Umělecké skupiny: Overland Inn

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
Alfred ve dvoře, Františka Křížka 36, Praha 7
description:
_The 2019 Bazaar Festival_ starts off with a choreographic creation focusing on representations of the Body in relation to Power. How does someone’s body become a symbol of power? Is it someone else’s power that creates an image inside of us so strong that we submit to it? Or is it we, the masses thirsty for leaders, who create and maintain it? When the body falls, how is the fall of power announced? Lebanese dancer/choreographer explores these questions in a performance tracing the rise and fall of power, playing with its gestures, building a victory and witnessing its demise. She creates her own image of body and power, then destroys it to see what happens.
Autor: Khouloud Yassine
Umělci: Khouloud Yassine

Srdečně vás zveme na další z neformálních setkání se starostou Janem Čižinským v sedmičkových hospůdkách a kavárnách. Uskuteční se ve čtvrtek 7. března od 18:00 v Restauraci U Divadla (Pplk. Sochora 9). Na setkání se na vás kromě pana starosty bude těšit také radní pro veřejný prostor a životní prostředí Jiří Knitl. Opět se budete moci ptát na vše, co vás zajímá, nebo nám přijít říct, co máte na srdci.

O víkendu 23.–24. března 2019 , sobota 10–17, neděle 10–15, pořádá Spolek Korunka spolu se ZŠ Korunovační již 5. jarní CHARITATIVNÍ BAZAR PRO KORUNKU. Přijďte si doplnit výbavu pro děti, obstarat dámský či pánský model, vybrat si dobrou knihu, něco užitečného do domácnosti či ke sportování nebo prostě najít poklad, bez kterého nebudete moci odejít! Občerstvení najdete v bazarové kavárně. 

Pestrý doprovodný program zajistíme spolu s místními kulturními a zájmovými institucemi. Slosovatelné vstupenky za dobrovolný příspěvek  Vám umožní získat hodnotné ceny nejen od lokálních sponzorů, v tiché aukci můžete vydražit originální díla či zážitky za velmi výhodné ceny.

Výtěžek bazaru bude věnován na doučování dětí s výukovým handicapem, který již 3.rokem přináší prospěch i ostatním žákům a pedagogům.  Podpořeny budou i další aktivity ve prospěch žáků školy.

Oblečení a předměty, které se během bazaru neprodají, budou ve spolupráci s MČ Praha 7 věnovány sociálně slabým rodinám a seniorům z Prahy 7  a Diakonii Broumov. 

Charitativní bazar se i tento rok koná pod záštitou starosty městské části Praha 7 Jana Čižinského.

Můžete nás podpořit i Vy, pokud věnujete čisté a nepoškozené oblečení a další vhodné předměty, sponzorský dar či se osobně zúčastníte. Čisté a nepoškozené věci přijímáme ve vrátnici školy (ul. Sládkova) ve všední dny 13–17h již čtrnáct dní před akcí.
Předem děkujeme za donesené předměty a těšíme se na Vaši návštěvu jarního bazaru v ZŠ Korunovační! 

Více info na: www.facebook.com/events, spolek-korunka.webnode.cz nebo na spolekkorunka@seznam.cz

location: Památník ticha, nádraží Bubny, Bubenská 8b, Praha 7
description: Před 75 lety byla spáchána největší genocida českých občanů v celé naší historii. Vyhlazení tzv. Terezínského rodinného tábora v Osvětimi připravilo o život během jediné noci na 4000 žen, mužů i dětí. Památník ticha Bubny uspořádá ve čtvrtek 7. března od 18 hodin na nádraží Bubny v ulici Bubenská 8b vzpomínkový koncert. V podání orchestru Gymnázia Přírodní škola zazní písně dětí z terezínského sirotčince a motivy z textů Hanuše Haachenburga. Dále vystoupí česká sopranistka Irena Troupová. Vzpomínkový program vznikl ve spolupráci s Institutem terezínských skladatelů.

_Rascals Drink'n'Draw_ is an event mainly for videogames or film professionals and art students who would like to get better in their craft. Under our Art Director guidance you would be able to try out different poses, lighting exercises and time-stamped "shorts" for quick sketches. And if you tire of drawing and sketching you can always exchange tips and news with others over some good beer or wine!

*Radical Bulgarian icon of contemporary European choreography, performance art and song Ivo Dimchev returns to Prague at last.* His solo is made to heal not only particular physical or psychological difficulties you have but also all of them simultaneously! _I-Cure_ is not just one-to-one therapy, it is designed to cure every audience member at the same time! _I-Cure_ can also heal people you love and care for, it all depends on where you would like to focus the healing power of _I-Cure_... Making reference to interactive TV shows, with images of palm-tree islands and crackling open fires, Dimchev, dressed in drag, seeks positive energy in music, dance, esotericism, spirituality, massage and sex. His Great Healing is extremely comical until the turning point, the almost unendurable catharsis at the end. _If healing is a choice then why not to make this choice while being in the theatre? Why waste an hour trying to be more "cultural", when we can use it to be "healthier"?_
Autor: Ivo Dimchev

_MINE_ by T.I.T.S. is an audio-visual dance concert/physical opera that researches the relationship between people and their sense of possessing - the instinctual drive within human nature to make territories, to "own" things.
Umělecké skupiny: T.I.T.S.
Autor: Nela H. Kornetová
Umělci: Nela H. Kornetová, Lærke Grøntved, Tobias Shaw Petersen, Josephine Kylén-Collins

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Felicia and François have bipolar disorder. What takes place in their minds? How do they reflect their manic and depressive states? For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. The audiotapes on which the 2 confide their lyrical hallucinations as well as their painful anxieties became the basis for a virtual reality project. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.
Režisér: Kalina Bertin

Over the past decade a good many Congolese and other Africans have set out for China following dreams of riches and a better life, but only a very few of them have found the promised land in the Middle Empire. Fely, the film’s protagonist, first arrived in China from Kinshasa in 2009. He learned the language, made money, and helped to establish one of the first African communities in Tian Xiu. He settled here and, thanks to his contacts, negotiates business deals with local enterprises for arriving African businessmen. Even Fely’s life is not easy in this country, burdened by prejudices against foreigners and constantly changing immigration laws, and things are even harder for newcomers. Things don’t always go smoothly in China, and many have no choice other than to return home empty-handed.

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Anna and Lauren are twins. Their lives had always been intimately connected, until the fateful night when on her way home Anna was hit by a car. They loved walking home together in the dark and talking. One December night, the young girls' carefree discussion was interrupted by a dramatic incident. Anna was hit by a car and ended up in hospital. For some time she lost her memory, could not fully control her body, could not dress herself. Her sister Lauren often did not know how to help her. This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. At first, the audience chooses whether they want to hear the story from Anna's point of view or from Lauren's point of view. Which feeling is worse in the end? Powerlessness or the inability to help the person we love most?
Režisér: Claire Bates

event_name: Why Everyone Left + Hang Tight + more
description: Umělecké skupiny: Why Everyone LeftHang TightMay 24th2000blackvoices BookingMy Hard LessonToo Far From Home

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
One of the strangest trends in contemporary China is duplication: copying not only specific architectural monuments but also entire neighbourhoods. What's it like living in fake Venice or Paris? At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a "fake" environment, retain their own lifestyle.
Režisér: Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Since the beginning of the war in Yemen, which is now continuing for the fourth year, more than 10,000 people have been killed due to air strikes. The documentary presents the stories of three children whose lives have been marked by war. At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.
Režisér: Viktorija Mickute

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
The shamans of the Yawanawa, an Amazonian tribe, treat wounded bodies in conditions very similar to hallucination. The healers have always been men since time immemorial. But the resolute Hushahu decides that this must end. After drinking a mysterious potion, the shaman falls into a state of deep vision. He sees and feels the sap of trees and their vibrant life; he passes through flooded forests, which are the reflection of the sick man's mind. Nature and body are connected here in one entity. The leader of the Yawanawa tribe decides to break the taboo for the first time and allows the first woman to enter into this sacred state. This virtual reality project, reminiscent in its fantastic stylisation of James Cameron's Avatar, was created in close collaboration with members of the Amazon tribe. The resulting film presents both a faithful record of the unique ritual and a universal story of female emancipation.
Režisér: Lynette Wallworth

Director François-Xavier Drouet heads to the French forests. Their surface area is growing, but their diversity is declining. What are the paths to a viable forest? Loggers with monstrous machines reminiscent of Transformers see the forest only as a fruitful wood plantation where there is no place for living creatures. And against them are the conservationists, foresters or lumberjacks who see the forest as a living continuum and who seek to preserve it. The director provides an insight into the everyday routine of a diverse range of people connected with the forest for good and ill. He records and follows them in their natural environment to bring the audience closer to the broader aspects of forest management and the personal philosophy of those who are involved in it, whether as bearers of the trend of turning the forest into a "wood factory" or as supporters of cultivation approaches.
Režisér: François-Xavier Drouet

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Reporter Nicolas decides to set up his first Instagram account and accumulate as many followers as possible. Over time, he becomes more interested in the social network´s inner workings and uncovers a well-oiled machine based on fraud. Instagram is like a showcase where people promote themselves. „All you see is this glamorous page. You don’t see what is happening behind the scenes.” explains Mike, who works at Dovetale, a company that analyses social media. While users enthusiastically give likes to selfies, a brisk business with user accounts is under way behind the scenes. There are huge numbers of fake profiles, and internet bots are producing new followers for those who want to feel more successful. Can anything on Instagram be believed?
Režisér: Nicolaas Veul, Duco Coops

Kunál Singh is an energetic and confident boy. He goes to school, enjoys watching movies from which he quotes his favourite lines, and knows all the world's capitals by heart. Kunál is also blind, but it does not prevent him from joining the singing competition organized by the School for the Blind. He and his classmate make sure they will win. His beloved grandmother has always given him courage and taught him not to believe the Indian superstition that a blind man is born because of transgressions in a previous life. Thanks to her, Kunál believes that despite his disability he can do everything he sets his mind to.
Režisér: Anneke de Lind van Wijngaarden,Annelies Kruk

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
French farmer Cédric has permitted hundreds of refugees traveling from Africa to Europe to stay in his humble dwelling. Despite the threat of imprisonment he acts in accordance with his conscience and faith in human dignity. Every month, thousands of refugees try to cross the Italian-French border in the Roya Valley in order to get to France or beyond. However, the French border guards repeatedly send them back to Italy and make it impossible for them to seek asylum. The only one to offer them shelter and a helping hand is the local farmer Cédric. The director captures his actions and follows him in everyday moments in which the world's political debates and a battle of fundamental philosophical ideas are reflected. This portrayal of a farmer whose life has been affected by world history, to which he reacts as best he can, is an inspirational demonstration of what an individual who is not afraid to help can change.
Režisér: Michel Toesca

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7

Little Dulce is afraid of water. But in a village on the Pacific coast, being able to swim is more important than anything else in her life. The location for this poetic film from Colombia is surrounded by mangrove marshes. Every day the community is threatened by global climate change, as the sea level is set to rise so much that their dwellings will disappear underwater. The unique ecosystem of mangroves on the seashore and the mainland plays an important role in helping to alleviate the warming. Dulce's mother teaches her to swim and promises her that one day, when she overcomes her fear, she will be able to accompany her and the other women from the village in the marshes for the traditional shell harvest.
Režisér: Angello Faccini,Guille Isa

Bashir is 10 and lives with his mother and siblings in a refugee camp in the middle of the Algerian desert. One day he gets a unique chance to go to Spain for the summer. Few of the stateless people in the refugee camp where Bashir's West Saharan family has been living for generations are able to travel across the border. The days in the camp are interminable, especially in the summer when there is no school. For Bashir, a holiday in the care of a Spanish family is a dream come true. Escalators, traffic lights, high-rises – all this is new for him in the heart of bustling Barcelona. Even his first visit to the dentist is an exciting experience. Will his wish to swim in the sea also come true?
Režisér: Evelien Vehof,Els Duran

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Five years in the life of a courageous young woman named Amal against the backdrop of the rapidly changing political environment in Egypt. What if someone wants the best for their country, but gradually discovers that the greatest battles are with those closest to them? It is a year after the revolution. Against the backdrop of a silenced citizenry's calls for the right to ultimate self-determination comes the very personal story of 15-year-old Amal, who stands side by side with her friends at the head of protests for a more just and freer Egypt. With the passing years, however, it is becoming ever clearer that even those who stand at the barricades with Amal are ignorant of the fact that an Egyptian woman cannot freely choose what to wear or how to spend her free time. As Amal grows up, she learns that finding a place in a society dominated by men will be at least as demanding as finding a new face for her country.
Režisér: Mohamed Siam

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:

Afghanistan has a booming opium trade and it is very easy to fall victim to heroin addiction. Laila, an uncompromising woman and restaurateur doesn’t intend to accept this. One dose of heroin in Kabul costs the same as a loaf of bread. The risk of addiction is everywhere and recovering from it is extremely difficult. Laila and her brother, an addict for 30 years, help hundreds of people find a way to a new, drug-free life. During their endeavors, they face not only a lack of confidence in their treatment method, but mainly a system in which the drug mafia is interlinked with government structures. Laila represents the only hope for hundreds of people in an otherwise hopeless cycle of drugs, in which every saved life is a miracle. How will she come to terms with this difficult task, which eats up all her income and is hugely emotionally draining?
Režisér: Elizabeth Mirzaei, Gulistan Mirzaei

The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a "fake" environment, retain their own lifestyle.
Režisér: Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Since the beginning of the war in Yemen, which is now continuing for the fourth year, more than 10,000 people have been killed due to air strikes. The documentary presents the stories of three children whose lives have been marked by war. At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.
Režisér: Viktorija Mickute

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
The shamans of the Yawanawa, an Amazonian tribe, treat wounded bodies in conditions very similar to hallucination. The healers have always been men since time immemorial. But the resolute Hushahu decides that this must end. After drinking a mysterious potion, the shaman falls into a state of deep vision. He sees and feels the sap of trees and their vibrant life; he passes through flooded forests, which are the reflection of the sick man's mind. Nature and body are connected here in one entity. The leader of the Yawanawa tribe decides to break the taboo for the first time and allows the first woman to enter into this sacred state. This virtual reality project, reminiscent in its fantastic stylisation of James Cameron's Avatar, was created in close collaboration with members of the Amazon tribe. The resulting film presents both a faithful record of the unique ritual and a universal story of female emancipation.
Režisér: Lynette Wallworth

Mental coaching methods and various mind training approaches are rapidly developing and can be used in almost any field. Both police and small children are taught self-control in this way. Mental coaching. What does this phrase conceal? It can take on many forms – from individual therapy to simulated training situations. Without any protagonists, interviews or supplementary comments, a static observational camera captures aggression control training, working with emotions, a workshop for preschool age children, and therapy based on massaging pigs. The film alternates between situations and environments as quickly as the participants’ emotions intermingle. At what point does something start to slowly change in them?
Režisér: Menna Laura Meijer

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Felicia and François have bipolar disorder. What takes place in their minds? How do they reflect their manic and depressive states? For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. The audiotapes on which the 2 confide their lyrical hallucinations as well as their painful anxieties became the basis for a virtual reality project. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.
Režisér: Kalina Bertin

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Anna and Lauren are twins. Their lives had always been intimately connected, until the fateful night when on her way home Anna was hit by a car. They loved walking home together in the dark and talking. One December night, the young girls' carefree discussion was interrupted by a dramatic incident. Anna was hit by a car and ended up in hospital. For some time she lost her memory, could not fully control her body, could not dress herself. Her sister Lauren often did not know how to help her. This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. At first, the audience chooses whether they want to hear the story from Anna's point of view or from Lauren's point of view. Which feeling is worse in the end? Powerlessness or the inability to help the person we love most?
Režisér: Claire Bates

Talented Ukrainian soccer player Alina divides her time between the playing field and caring for her siblings. This intimate portrait presents a strong young woman whose worst adversaries are not on the soccer field but in her personal life. From 7, Alina has grown up mainly on the streets, where soccer became her escape from reality. Her mother alternates time in prison with days of freedom; her stepfather is an alcoholic, jobless for 9 years. Alina is raising two younger siblings solo: she picks them up from school after her training, cooks for them, and reads them bedtime stories. She has decided to devote the time she would otherwise spend on the field to holding the family together. After her mother dies, her stepfather’s drinking worsens. Knowing the children could be taken away from her, Alina starts to sell her belongings, including her cleats, to pay the rent. Nevertheless, she continues to dream about her soccer career.
Režisér: Alisa Kovalenko

event_name: Don’t Be a Dick About It
description:
A sibling odyssey set in American suburbia that captures the daily struggle for attention and constant goading, as well as tolerance of someone else's differences. Matthew loves sports and physical activity, but is afraid of dogs. Peter's favourite activity is watching Survivor and eating doughnuts. What are the challenges of growing up with a totally different person with whom your only connection is sharing the same parents? Over the course of a year, the film follows the brothers' quarrels and skirmishes, culminating in Peter's birthday party, which is naturally inspired by his favourite reality TV show "The tribe has spoken," followed by a long silence between the brothers. A funny documentary full of wilful acts of sibling rivalry, mutual understanding and brotherly love.
Režisér: Ben Mullinkosson

*A workshop led by Adrienn Hód (HU) based on the choreographic language of her company Hodworks.*

This workshop is about participants’ personal research of their own bodies. Hód offers tools and possible directions so that each everyone can go their own way. Imagination plays a big role in her approach, with the goal of finding a place where the body can be free, present, and ready to react. A place where the body can set itself free from deep-rooted forms and thoughts, and rewrite itself, forming a new universe for motion. Hód has founded her choreography on the quest to create a special kind of experiential presence in performers. During the workshop participants will not only get to broaden the repertoire of their artistic instruments but look inside the creative methods of Hodworks, as well.

Hód’s teaching methods, tasks, and directions are strongly interconnected with Hodwork’s artistic practice. Often she builds workshops around the creative process used for one of her pieces in rehearsal, but sometimes she chooses a new starting point, forming new material through the teaching process, to be used later on the stage. She is drawn to the creation of new movement through methods connected to the tools of improvisation.

Hód focuses on the body itself, taken from its cultural context and placed in an empty space. During studio work, she creates intimate situations in which dancers are offered space and trust to open their physicality. Hód’s method is based on improvisation that then appears in a structured frame on stage. She is not afraid of working on the unknown and taboo.

*The workshop will be in English.*

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description: Režisér: Kateřina Turečková

They want to live a completely ordinary life. But they were born in the refugee camp of Tifariti in the middle of the Sahara. Three young friends find themselves in absurd and dramatic situations. Sídahmed, Zaara and Tahar live in the territory between Algeria, Morocco and the Western Sahara. They are refugees known as Saharans, literally "desert people". Their home is divided by a high wall and a minefield. They have heard of it only from their parents, they cannot see it for themselves. Each deals with their fate in a different way. Sídahmed dreams of a new life in Spain, where many of his friends have fled. Zaara is looking for a job, and is not discouraged by the fact that she doesn't know how to do anything. In her free time she learns how to drive, even though she has no place to go. An unusual documentary set in a refugee camp, whose protagonists act in front of the camera as though it were not there at all.
Režisér: Eloy Domínguez Serén

Tel Aviv's central bus station is one of the largest in the world. But the seven-storey concrete complex is straight out of a Kafka novel. People get lost here and the sixth floor is totally missing. Yonathan is able to navigate the maze of endless corridors, staircases and hidden rooms like no one else. The bus station and its incomprehensibility have become the meaning of life for him; in it he has found the perfect metaphor for his homeland, to which he has a complicated relationship. He accompanies tourists through the bowels of this extensive and illogically designed building, sharing with them the secrets it has revealed. And he meets a very diverse society – among the patrolling soldiers there are wandering African asylum seekers, Philippine salesmen and Orthodox Jews. This visually exhilarating and inventively edited film captures a closed world that works according to its own rules.
Režisér: Tomáš Elšík

Journalist Shakila and politician Nilofar are battling for democracy and women’s rights in Afghanistan. A film about courage and finding a balance between love of one’s country and one’s family. _“We have a responsibility to speak on behalf of every woman, from the remote mountains of Pamir to Nuristan."_ This film tracks 2 women who are not afraid to be heard. Shakila, a TV reporter and single mother of 3, is a star in her field and openly talks about the Talibans’s violence and the situation of rural women. Nilofar is an MP and a mother lobbying for a law that would punish violence against women. Along with more suicide attacks and dead in the streets, the families of the 2 women receive threats. Both face a difficult decision: Remain in their beloved country and continue to openly fight for freedom even at the cost of placing themselves and their entire families at risk? Or leave while there’s still time?
Režisér: Sedika Mojadidi

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7

On the remote New Siberian Islands in the Arctic Ocean, hunters are searching for the tusks of extinct mammoths. There is a gold rush fever in the air. The price for white gold has never been so high. The thawing permafrost not only releases precious ivory. The tusk hunters find a surprisingly well-preserved mammoth carcass. Such finds are magnets for high-tech genetic scientists. They want to bring the extinct woolly mammoth back to life à la "Jurassic Park". Resurrecting the mammoth is a first manifestation of the next great technological revolution. Man becomes Creator. Genesis two point zero. A Film about the secrets and mysteries hidden within nature and the fundamental difference in view of creation and the role of man in it.
Režisér: Christian Frei, Maxim Arbugaev

event_name: Bellingcat – Truth in a Post-Truth World
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Fake news. Alternative media. Troll farms. This is only one side of today’s information reality. There is a second one. Fact-checking. Civic journalism. Bellingcat. Shot down flight MH-17, civilian bombing in Syria and agent Skripal’s poisoning – all stories with ambiguities enhanced by targeted digital disinformation. But digital weapons are not used by just one side and the civic journalists of the international Bellingcat network know where to aim. The film reveals this respected organization’s background and presents its main players in various countries and how they are connected via electronic channels. Specific cases interspersed with narrative clearly show how digital fragments can be used to reconstruct something that seemed lost long ago – facts.
Režisér: Hans Pool

Bashir is 10 and lives with his mother and siblings in a refugee camp in the middle of the Algerian desert. One day he gets a unique chance to go to Spain for the summer. Few of the stateless people in the refugee camp where Bashir's West Saharan family has been living for generations are able to travel across the border. The days in the camp are interminable, especially in the summer when there is no school. For Bashir, a holiday in the care of a Spanish family is a dream come true. Escalators, traffic lights, high-rises – all this is new for him in the heart of bustling Barcelona. Even his first visit to the dentist is an exciting experience. Will his wish to swim in the sea also come true?
Režisér: Evelien Vehof,Els Duran

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
The shamans of the Yawanawa, an Amazonian tribe, treat wounded bodies in conditions very similar to hallucination. The healers have always been men since time immemorial. But the resolute Hushahu decides that this must end. After drinking a mysterious potion, the shaman falls into a state of deep vision. He sees and feels the sap of trees and their vibrant life; he passes through flooded forests, which are the reflection of the sick man's mind. Nature and body are connected here in one entity. The leader of the Yawanawa tribe decides to break the taboo for the first time and allows the first woman to enter into this sacred state. This virtual reality project, reminiscent in its fantastic stylisation of James Cameron's Avatar, was created in close collaboration with members of the Amazon tribe. The resulting film presents both a faithful record of the unique ritual and a universal story of female emancipation.
Režisér: Lynette Wallworth
Umělecké skupiny: NoijaGrieverLVNGStifledBrighter DaysToothwalker 2000blackvoices Booking

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
When Feurat Alani first visited Iraq he was nine years old. At that time, in 1989, he came from his native Paris to a modern country and found his second home there. When he was 12, he was offered a car in exchange for his French shoes. From such personal memories, Léonard Cohen has compiled a book and later this series. He playfully discusses not only the conflicts in Iraq, but also quite ordinary things. Rather than presenting numbers and dates, the film leaves impressions and feelings. The authentic narrative gradually makes the viewer forget that it is an animated film, while also conveying impressions such as the flavour of apricot ice cream or the smell of gunpowder.
Režisér: Leonard Cohen

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
- _Is Anna OK?_ / Claire Bates / GB, 2018 / 10 min – Anna and Lauren are twins. Their lives had always been intimately connected, until the fateful night when on her way home Anna was hit by a car. They loved walking home together in the dark and talking. One December night, the young girls' carefree discussion was interrupted by a dramatic incident. Anna was hit by a car and ended up in hospital. For some time she lost her memory, could not fully control her body, could not dress herself. Her sister Lauren often did not know how to help her. This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. At first, the audience chooses whether they want to hear the story from Anna's point of view or from Lauren's point of view. Which feeling is worse in the end? Powerlessness or the inability to help the person we love most?

- _Manic VR_ / Kalina Bertin / Canada, 2018 / 11 min – For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. The audiotapes on which the 2 confide their lyrical hallucinations as well as their painful anxieties became the basis for a virtual reality project. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.

- _Terminal 3_ / Asad Malik / USA, Pakistan, 2018 / 12 min – “Please wait in line, your interview will begin shortly,” says the coordinator at the entrance to a faithfully stylized interrogation room. From the start, this theatrical VR project tries to evoke a realistic atmosphere for the customs screening process. In the austere room, once the spectator puts on the augmented reality glasses, they become the interrogator. Those they must question, often in a very incorrect manner, appear as holograms in the chair opposite them. Because of his Pakistani origin, the project’s creator, Asad Malik, has himself participated in several such interrogations. As a result, his work provides a unique glimpse, both technologically and content-wise, into the current uncompromising immigration policy of the USA.

- _Make Noise_ / May Abdalla / UK, 2018 / 8 min – Several pieces of clothing hanging on a clothesline. Dozens of blouses, sheets and skirts form an impenetrable barrier through which the outside world cannot be seen. A prison consisting of stereotypical symbols of femininity. For the women to free the audience, they must scream. Only then will the barrier break, the clothes fly away, and women can start fighting for their rights. Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. This VR experience is dedicated to all war correspondents who have lost their lives while doing their work

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

For the women to free the audience, they must scream. Only then will the barrier break, the clothes fly away, and women can start fighting for their rights. Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. This VR experience is dedicated to all war correspondents who have lost their lives while doing their work

This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. - _Manic VR_ / Kalina Bertin / Canada, 2018 / 11 min – For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.

As a result, his work provides a unique glimpse, both technologically and content-wise, into the current uncompromising immigration policy of the USA.

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Director Sandra Trostel goes on a trip – in a cartoon rocket, a time machine from Doctor Who, and other playful means. With different forms and positions, she initiates creative interaction with the events, individuals and thoughts that characterize the events organized by CCC. In an interactive game, she completes seven “levels”, each representing a certain degree of insight into the free-thinking hacker philosophy – from focus placed on diversity, tolerance and curiosity to more serious ideas about the positive as well as the negative roles technology plays in today’s world.
Režisér: Sandra Trostel

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
During the game, streamed live over the internet, one player is chosen and the others falsely report him to the police. Then they wait… Within a short time, the unsuspecting victim’s house is infiltrated by an armed SWAT team. All of this is broadcast live. The number of such cases is on the rise and officials are powerless. This vivid short film skillfully combines real shots from the streamed games in which the police were involved, 911 calls and the testimony of victims of this modern entertainment, all interspersed with fascinating animation of the gaming “landscape”.
Režisér: Ismaël Joffroy Chandoutis

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

The documentary is about Nour, a journalist who covers the plight of Syrian and Iraqi women and children in the war against the Islamic State terrorists and mercenaries.
Režisér: Reza Farahmand

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
Who are the people who send the emails announcing that you have won the lottery and who is really hiding behind the profiles of the women on internet dating sites? The director of the film went to Ghana, where whole communities make their living this way. In their efforts they use all available means – imitating female voices over the phone, and even involving magicians, black magic and voodoo. This entertaining and very personal documentary follows several characters efforts to break free from poverty by satisfying the unfulfilled desires of people from rich countries.
Režisér: Ben Asamoah

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
- _Is Anna OK?_ / Claire Bates / GB, 2018 / 10 min – Anna and Lauren are twins. Their lives had always been intimately connected, until the fateful night when on her way home Anna was hit by a car. They loved walking home together in the dark and talking. One December night, the young girls' carefree discussion was interrupted by a dramatic incident. Anna was hit by a car and ended up in hospital. For some time she lost her memory, could not fully control her body, could not dress herself. Her sister Lauren often did not know how to help her. This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. At first, the audience chooses whether they want to hear the story from Anna's point of view or from Lauren's point of view. Which feeling is worse in the end? Powerlessness or the inability to help the person we love most?

- _Manic VR_ / Kalina Bertin / Canada, 2018 / 11 min – For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. The audiotapes on which the 2 confide their lyrical hallucinations as well as their painful anxieties became the basis for a virtual reality project. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.

- _Terminal 3_ / Asad Malik / USA, Pakistan, 2018 / 12 min – “Please wait in line, your interview will begin shortly,” says the coordinator at the entrance to a faithfully stylized interrogation room. From the start, this theatrical VR project tries to evoke a realistic atmosphere for the customs screening process. In the austere room, once the spectator puts on the augmented reality glasses, they become the interrogator. Those they must question, often in a very incorrect manner, appear as holograms in the chair opposite them. Because of his Pakistani origin, the project’s creator, Asad Malik, has himself participated in several such interrogations. As a result, his work provides a unique glimpse, both technologically and content-wise, into the current uncompromising immigration policy of the USA.

- _Make Noise_ / May Abdalla / UK, 2018 / 8 min – Several pieces of clothing hanging on a clothesline. Dozens of blouses, sheets and skirts form an impenetrable barrier through which the outside world cannot be seen. A prison consisting of stereotypical symbols of femininity. For the women to free the audience, they must scream. Only then will the barrier break, the clothes fly away, and women can start fighting for their rights. Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. This VR experience is dedicated to all war correspondents who have lost their lives while doing their work
