event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
In 2015, South African universities again increased their tuition fees. Students at Witwatersrand University demanded affordable education and stood against the systematic exclusion of poor blacks from higher education under the hashtag #FeesMustFall. The police intervention against them triggered protests at universities across the country, and over the following months, the dispute over fees grew into a fight against deeply rooted social inequalities. Based on the testimonies of student leaders and the vice-president of the university, brutal scenes directly from the front lines of the protests and subsequent media reports, the development of the revived efforts for universal freedom are documented in meticulous detail.
Režisér: Rehad Desai

event_name: VR II: Zero Days VR + Yemen's Skies of Terror
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- Zero Days VR_ / Yasmine Elayat / USA, 2017 / 21 min – The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a zero day vulnerability. Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.

- _Yemen's Skies of Terror_ / Viktorija Mickute / Yemen, 2018 / 6 min – At first glance, 17-year-old Abu Bakr was lucky. He was on his way to the pharmacy when a bomb hit his house. But his parents and three sisters were in the house, so in one brief moment he lost his whole family. The bombing began in 2015 after the rebels (Houthis) occupied Yemen's capital Sanaʽa. The Saudi-led coalition has responded to this by a military intervention that still persists. Abu Bakr, seven-year-old Widad and 15-year-old Akram live in constant fear of raids and uncertainty about where food and other basic living requirements will come from. Combining documentary and animated scenes, this VR film offers a unique look into the lives of children in a war-ravaged city.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
- _Is Anna OK?_ / Claire Bates / GB, 2018 / 10 min – Anna and Lauren are twins. Their lives had always been intimately connected, until the fateful night when on her way home Anna was hit by a car. They loved walking home together in the dark and talking. One December night, the young girls' carefree discussion was interrupted by a dramatic incident. Anna was hit by a car and ended up in hospital. For some time she lost her memory, could not fully control her body, could not dress herself. Her sister Lauren often did not know how to help her. This animated VR story, based on a real event, illustrates the trauma of both sisters from two different points of view. At first, the audience chooses whether they want to hear the story from Anna's point of view or from Lauren's point of view. Which feeling is worse in the end? Powerlessness or the inability to help the person we love most?

- _Manic VR_ / Kalina Bertin / Canada, 2018 / 11 min – For 3 years Kalina Bertin recorded the voices of her siblings who have bipolar disorder. The audiotapes on which the 2 confide their lyrical hallucinations as well as their painful anxieties became the basis for a virtual reality project. In it, the participants walk through the symbolic rooms in the two siblings’ minds, where galactic nebulae materialise, where they enter a rain forest with flying knives or a dim, compressed cell. Using immersive experience, the project draws attention to the complexity of the world and the fragility of the lives of people for whom their own minds have become both a magical labyrinth and a demonic cave.

- _Terminal 3_ / Asad Malik / USA, Pakistan, 2018 / 12 min – “Please wait in line, your interview will begin shortly,” says the coordinator at the entrance to a faithfully stylized interrogation room. From the start, this theatrical VR project tries to evoke a realistic atmosphere for the customs screening process. In the austere room, once the spectator puts on the augmented reality glasses, they become the interrogator. Those they must question, often in a very incorrect manner, appear as holograms in the chair opposite them. Because of his Pakistani origin, the project’s creator, Asad Malik, has himself participated in several such interrogations. As a result, his work provides a unique glimpse, both technologically and content-wise, into the current uncompromising immigration policy of the USA.

- _Make Noise_ / May Abdalla / UK, 2018 / 8 min – Several pieces of clothing hanging on a clothesline. Dozens of blouses, sheets and skirts form an impenetrable barrier through which the outside world cannot be seen. A prison consisting of stereotypical symbols of femininity. For the women to free the audience, they must scream. Only then will the barrier break, the clothes fly away, and women can start fighting for their rights. Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. This VR experience is dedicated to all war correspondents who have lost their lives while doing their work

Dozens of blouses, sheets and skirts form an impenetrable barrier through which the outside world cannot be seen. A prison consisting of stereotypical symbols of femininity. For the women to free the audience, they must scream. Only then will the barrier break, the clothes fly away, and women can start fighting for their rights. Other smaller games unlock the other parts of the project, which feature archival testimonies of British suffragettes and thus complete a multi-layered experience of the struggle for female emancipation. This unique animated VR project, which works with the human voice, was presented at the prestigious Venice festival.

- _Blindfild_ / Navid Khonsari, Vassiliki Knonsari / USA, 2018 / 8 min – It is 1979 and Iran is in the throes of a revolution that will forever change the shape of the country. People in the streets protest against the increasing Islamisation and radical behaviour of the ruling forces. The more courageous journalists uncover the violent propaganda practices of the new leaders. Many of these journalists end up in jail. This virtual reality project draws on one of the stories of an anonymous journalist, interrogated by the notorious investigator Asadollah Lajevardi. This project on the boundary of documentary and animated film works with the viewer's reactions – they respond to Lajevardi's questions either by nodding their head yes or shaking their head no. This VR experience is dedicated to all war correspondents who have lost their lives while doing their work

event_name: VR III: The Real Thing + Rone
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.*

- _The Real Thing_ / Benoit Felici, Mathias Chelebourg/ France, 2018 / 16 min – At first glance it's clearly the Eiffel Tower. On the second, something clearly isn't right. The tower is too low, there are only Chinese inscriptions everywhere, and there's not a single patisserie in sight, the horizon instead lined with prefab concrete blocks. This fake Eiffel Tower is located in the centre of Changsha, whose magnificent name hides a not so exalted reality. It is a modern Potemkin village where the monuments of several Western metropolises are brought together in a strange mix. This visually captivating VR documentary shows how local people, despite living in a that environment, retain their own lifestyle.

- _Rone_ / Lester Francois / Australia, 2018 / 9 min – Australian artist Rone moved to Melbourne in 2001 and immediately fell in love with the street art scene. The excess of masculinity and violence that was there at the time was ubiquitous, and he decided to balance it with a female element. Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.

location: Alfred ve dvoře, Františka Křížka 36, Praha 7
description: Autor: Tereza Říčanová

location: Alfred ve dvoře, Františka Křížka 36, Praha 7
description: Autor: Tereza Říčanová

In early 18th century England, a frail Queen Anne (Colman) occupies the throne and her close friend Lady Sarah (Weisz) governs the country in her stead. When a new servant Abigail (Stone) arrives, her charm endears her to Sarah.
Režisér: Yorgos Lanthimos
Umělci: Olivia Colman, Rachel Weisz, Emma Stone, Nicholas Hoult, Joe Alwyn, Mark Gatiss, Wilson Radjou-Pujalte, Basil Eidenbenz, Alfrun Rose, Isaura Barbé-Brown

An epidemic that keeps returning. Last time it struck was in the West African state of Sierra Leone in 2014. A portrait of local humanitarian workers that captures the fight against the deadly Ebola virus. Filmmaker and local pastor Arthur Pratt focuses primarily on the stories of ambulance driver Mohamed Bangur and nurse Margaret Sesay, who, as first-line workers, come into frequent contact with the infected. This meticulously observational film presents their personal portraits, doubts, fears and joys, complemented by stories about their own family. The film explores not only the impact of the epidemic on families and society, but also shows an infrastructure broken by civil war and misunderstandings between international organisations and local communities.
Režisér: Anna Fitch,Banker White,Lansana Mansaray,Arthur Pratt

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
For nearly 30 years they fought for their right to vote. The stories of the early 20th century suffragettes take on an entirely new form in this VR experience. To complete the successful movement, they need the audience to literally make noise. Several pieces of clothing hanging on a clothesline. Dozens of blouses, sheets and skirts form an impenetrable barrier through which the outside world cannot be seen. A prison consisting of stereotypical symbols of femininity. location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
In 1964, Nelson Mandela stood before the court in Pretoria, South Africa. He was facing a death sentence for planning a coup d'état. But he was not alone. The second defendant was the now forgotten Walter Sisulu. There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs.
Režisér: Nicolas Champeaux, Gilles Porte

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
What is the perception and experience of an unborn baby whose mother, along with other refugees, is headed by boat for Europe? An immersive virtual reality film that offers a whole new look at the refugee crisis. Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Carolina Marconi

The last hurrah of four distinctive Finnish punks. A picture of friendship, rock and roll, roadblocks and falls. Hard-hitting lyrics, dark humour and spontaneity. From behind-the-scenes clashes to participation in the international Eurovision contest and the band's last concert, the documentary follows Finnish punk band "Pertti Kurikka's Nameday", already known from the film Punk Syndrome. The founding member of the band, Pertti, decided to go into well-deserved retirement. But before the foursome hang up their punk boots for good, they embark on a wild concert tour as a memorable finale to their musical career.
Režisér: Jukka Kärkkäinen, Jani-Petteri Passi
Umělci: Kari Aalto, Pertti Kurikka, Sami Helle, Niila Suoranta, Jutta Tahvanainen, Toni Välitalo, Conchita Wurst, Kalle Pajamaa

In Indonesia, otherwise beset by a number of serious problems, society is always ready to punish offences such as free thinking, tattoos or mohawks. Eka and his friends want nothing to do with majority Indonesian society. They hate everything about it – the social inequality, the ruthless pillaging of nature, the ubiquitous corruption. For young punks, their symbol of revolt becomes tattoos in visible places on the body. Although skin images are quite common in the traditional culture of the Indonesian tribes, since the days of the dictator Suharto they have come to be regarded as signs of criminality and shiftiness. Eka learns that this stigma is still strong when his own family disowns him. This remarkable film is the story of a longing for freedom, for which there is often no place in an intolerant Indonesian society burdened by its past and by prejudice and greed.
Režisér: Jimmy Hendrickx

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
The Stuxnet virus, which invaded Iran's nuclear facilities in 2010, is generally considered the first major test of the new style of war. Are cyberattacks the greatest security threat today? The uranium enrichment plant near the Iranian city of Natanz is located underground and is well-fortified. But not against sophisticated computer worms that use a software bug known as a "zero day vulnerability". Stuxnet, which disabled thousands of Iranian centrifuges, was not part of an isolated group of hackers – its parameters corresponded to the work of Western intelligence. However, no state has yet been accused of the attack. This VR documentary, warning against the threat of global cyberwar, introduces viewers to the grid of computer networks to where the battlefield of the 21st century has moved.
Režisér: Yasmine Elayat

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7

History and present, facts and myths, authenticity and stylisation – the film presents the peculiar inhabitants of the largest island of the world in imaginative contrasts and with subtle humour. Everyone knows Greenland. But who knows very much about its inhabitants and culture? How do you keep your national identity in a place so remote that the rest of the world rarely realises that someone lives there at all? The documentary lets the beautiful images of wild nature do the talking, a landscape in which the local civilisation has deeply embedded roots. Elements of the all-pervasive global culture sometimes disturb the original environment, sometimes they are assimilated in unexpected ways. Should inevitable change give rise to nostalgia and fear, or amusement and trust in the ability of the Greenlandic culture to survive in its own way?
Režisér: Lasse Lau

event_name: Far. The Story of Journey around the World
description:
Two young Germans spend three and a half years traveling around the world just by hitchhiking, bus, train and ship. They travel almost 100,000 kilometers through Europe, Asia, North and Central America.
Režisér: Patrick Allgaier,Gwendolin Weisser
Umělci: Patrick Allgaier, Gwendolin Weisser

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:

Enthusiasts from a fishing village in Sierra Leone dream of starting a surf club, but the negative stance of the local community complicates their plans. Jobs for young people along the remote African coast are dwindling in the same way as the number of fish in the sea. Inspired by foreign magazines, a group of enthusiasts decide to start a surf club, but their seemingly simple plan is met with unease in their traditionally collective community. The situation improves when they receive an invitation from an official surf club in Liberia. The trip to a neighboring country turns into a prestigious event as the 6 selected surfers slowly prepare for their first journey beyond the borders of Sierra Leone with the aim of catching bigger waves, gaining new experience, and taking the first steps towards becoming members of an international surf association.
Režisér: Gugi van der Velden

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7

Originally an African swamp, now a huge dump for European electronic waste and one of the world’s most toxic sites, Ghana’s Agbogbloshie continues to brim with activity. Despite the pollutants hovering over it, clinking metal can be heard at every step in this place nicknamed Sodom. And where metal clinks, coins jingle. This is what lures men, women, and children from afar. An economic ecosystem built on waste recycling exists here, and each of its participants has their own role and their own story. This film presents these stories in the form of comprehensive images showing the life of the entire community as well as intimate views of selected individuals, whose off-screen narrative leads us through their world where dirt mingles with color, dust with lyricism, and apocalyptic visions with magical realism.
Režisér: Florian Weigensamer, Christian Krönes

“Not ashamed of being seen” is the motto that the Berlin Bruisers – the first German gay rugby team – live by in their daily lives and when playing sports as they destroy all stereotypes on the playing field. From tough training and team evenings out to sharing life events, the film tracks a rugby club that functions more as a family than a sports team. The path to recognition and respect was marked by many lost battles both in life and on the field. After 3 years, others began to view the initially disregarded team as an equal opponent. The Berlin Bruisers not only play rugby but are also involved in an anti-bullying campaign, plan various charitable events and organize children’s workshops. This film captures their efforts to belong somewhere – in some places sensitive and quiet, in others happy and loud, just like the team, whose main mission is not to win but to achieve joy through sharing.
Režisér: Johannes List

Since then he has created exclusively giant, multi-dimensional murals of realistic female faces. This VR documentary provides an insight into Rone's creative process and in a meditative rhythm introduces audiences to his beloved deserted locations, which he decorated in his unmistakable style, whether it is a former cinema, an old paper mill or houses whose interiors have long been covered by dust. Since most of the buildings captured in the film have already been demolished, much of Rone's work is preserved only in the form of this virtual film.
Režisér: Lester Francois

Steubenville, Ohio found itself at the centre of attention in America in August 2012. The rape of a 16-year-old girl revealed that the roots of "rape culture" are deeply embedded in society. It would have been a party like any other... Had the members of the revered local football team not sexually abused an underage girl. Had they not started boasting online on social media platforms. And had one blogger not followed the digital traces of the crime. When the case came to light and attracted the attention of the media and the public, the neighbourhood tried to downplay the behaviour of "our boys" and to blame the victim, who after all must have known what she was getting herself into. The documentary reveals the crime layer by layer, exposing the complicity of coaches, teachers and parents, as well as the role social networks play in similar cases.
Režisér: Nancy Schwartzman

This Oscar-nominated film starts out as a tribute to the relaxed life in a skate community but goes on to reveal the roots of the vicious circle of domestic violence. Rockford, Illinois, never recovered from a crisis: unemployment is high and crime rates even higher. For Zack, Bing and Keire, growing up in dysfunctional families, skateboarding is their only escape from an unsettled reality. Originally, DOP and debuting director Bing Liu, who filmed his friends during their childhood, intended to make an experimental skate film, but his project gradually grew into something much bigger. Created over 12 years, the film captures with extraordinary naturalness, how seemingly carefree youth is penetrated by adult responsibilities, rules, unspoken secrets and wrongs. Is it possible to grow into adulthood in this environment, avoid the mistakes of one’s parents and still remain true to oneself?
Režisér: Bing Liu

Collective B plays with different aspects of violence, as well as with representing it in various, most exaggerated and intense shapes. Mainly, Mourlam is referring to violence presented as entertainment, creating a confrontation on stage between pleasure and pain, in which the viewer might slip into passivity, voyeuristic fascination, anxiety and emotional shocks.

Contemporary dance, physical theatre and live music weave together into a massacre on the scene. Somewhere between realism and slapstick, the two main characters “Peace” and “Love” will fight relentlessly against violence. Violent images, taken from the media, transposed by movement and music, with seriousness or humour, create paradoxes and at the same time clarify and widen the meaning of violence.

Expected premiere: February 2020 at WUK performing arts, Vienna

The _Saturday Bazaar_ is the core of the _Bazaar Festival_. Over the course of the event at Studio ALTA, audiences can look forward to four excerpts of future works by dance and theatre artists from North Macedonia, Bulgaria, Slovakia, the Czech Republic, and other countries. Excerpts will be followed by a moderated public discussion.

Excerpts to be presented are:
- _Proroctví_ / _Tabula Rasa_ – Jan Brejcha a Miki Zika (CZ)
- _An Experiment for Two (Or More)_ – Tinka Avramová (US/BG)
- _Songlines_ – Tomáš Janypka (CZ/SK)
- _Drag-on_ / _Steam Room_ – Aleksandar Georgiev a Zhana Pincheva (MK/BG)

_"Those who try to achieve exceptional things will make the most of their lives."_ For 14-year-old Skip, dance is everything. And despite the brutal bullying he faces because of his hobby, he wants to stay true to himself. Ambition and perseverance are certainly not in short supply in Skip. He and his boy dance group The Rhythm Rangers enter a competition and are working hard to win. While he feels in his element among his dancer friends Robin and Kynan, he prefers not to show off his vogue dance style at school. After all, who wants to constantly listen to insults and be told that "dancing is for girls and faggots"?
Režisér: Olivier S Garcia

The tragic death of UN General Secretary Dag Hammarskjöld in 1961 remains one of the greatest mysteries of the 20th century. Even today, there are many questions and conspiracy theories. Danish documentary filmmaker Mads Brügger and a Swedish private investigator follow the clues to try and solve a case that has baffled people for decades. Why did the plane carrying the world's highest ranking diplomat crash in Africa? Was it shot down? And if so, by whom? Was Hammarskjöld a victim of the Cold War between the US and the Soviet Union? Was he a thorn in the side of the former colonial powers due to his support for the newly independent African states? The search, which long led nowhere, suddenly uncovers crimes that are much more recent and much more terrifying. Or have the filmmakers themselves become victims of another conspiracy theory, this time their own?
Režisér: Mads Brügger
Umělci: Mads Brügger

_Gender's simple, extinct vampire walrus escaped from the melting North Pole and is now hiding under the performer's identity in Central Europe._ _Walrus Vampire Show_ combines elements of performance, alternative theater, fairy tales, stand up comedy, and anti-art with live music and social commentary. A new interpretation of nonsensical art.
Autor: Pasi Mäkelä

The film shows the brilliant career of the band, which, thanks to iconic songs and revolutionary sound, climbed to the heights of fame until Mercury's scandalous lifestyle did not put everything into question

Umělci: Rami Malek, Joseph Mazzello, Gwilym Lee, Ben Hardy, Allen Leech

Asghar Farhadi’s eighth offering Everybody Knows, which opened this year’s festival in Cannes, is another of his films to illustrate the complexities of human relationships and their ultimate transformation. Laura, a Spanish woman living in Buenos Aires with her husband and children, hardly ever goes back to her native country. The events that unfold on her final visit there change everyone’s lives. A sharply honed family drama starring the outstanding Penélope Cruz and Javier Bardem.
Režisér: Asghar Farhadi
Umělci: Javier Bardem, Penélope Cruz, Ricardo Darín, Bárbara Lennie, Inma Cuesta, Eduard Fernández, Elvira Mínguez, Roger Casamajor, Ramón Barea, Carla Campra

The most personal project to date from Academy Award (R)-winning director and writer Alfonso Cuarón (_Gravity, Children of Men, Y Tu Mama Tambien_), _Roma_ follows Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio), a young domestic worker for a family in the middle-class neighborhood of Roma in Mexico City. Delivering an artful love letter to the women who raised him, Cuarón draws on his own childhood to create a vivid and emotional portrait of domestic strife and social hierarchy amidst political turmoil of the 1970s.

location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
_#FollowMe_ / Nicolaas Veul, Duco Coops / Netherlands 2018 / 50 min. – Reporter Nicolas decides to set up his first Instagram account with the goal of accumulating as many followers as possible. Over time, he becomes more interested in the social network´s inner workings and uncovers a well-oiled machine based on fraud. Instagram is like a showcase where people promote themselves: _“All you see is this glamorous page. You don’t see what is happening behind the scenes.”_ explains Mike, who works at Dovetale, a company that analyzes social media. While users enthusiastically offer likes to selfies, a brisk business of user accounts is underway behind the scenes. There are huge numbers of fake profiles and internet bots producing new followers for those who want to feel more successful. Can anything on Instagram be believed?

_Swatting_ / Ismaël Joffroy Chandoutis / France 2018 / 21 min. – During a game, streamed live across the internet, one player is chosen by his peers and falsely reported to the police. Within a short time, the unsuspecting victim’s house is infiltrated by an armed SWAT team. All of this is broadcast live for others to watch. The number of such cases is on the rise, leaving officials are powerless. This vivid short film skillfully combines real shots from the streamed games in which police were involved, 911 calls, and the testimony of victims of this modern prank, all interspersed with fascinating animation of the gaming “landscape”.

event_name: VR I: Accused #2: Walter Sisulu + Nowhere
location: DOX Centrum současného umění, Poupětova 1, Praha 7
description:
*In the VR cinema, three bands of films are played each day at specific times. Viewers attend the screenings as they would a classic cinema. There are two short VR films in each slot, so the total time of a visit to the VR cinema does not exceed 30 minutes. The VR cinema has a capacity of 30 seats and reservations are made either online or directly in the DOX Gallery. Selected screenings will be followed by discussions with the creators and experts.* - _Accused #2: Walter Sisulu _ / Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux / France, 2018 / 14 min – There are no images from the trial of the leading African National Congress leaders who fought for the rights of blacks and against apartheid, but 256 hours of audio recordings have been preserved. Based on these recordings, a chalk-cartoon black-and-white animated film was created, reconstructing some key moments of the notorious court drama. The film places audiences in the front row of the courtroom, providing an immediate view of Walter Sisulu himself, who calmly and patiently resists cross-examination, as well as the haughty white prosecutor, determined to label him a terrorist at all costs. - _Nowhere_ / Carolina Marconi / GB, 2019 / 7 min – Waves splashing, engine humming, muted commands of the people smugglers, excited voices of other refugees, and most of all, the mother's heartbeat. These are the main things that the child hears in the mother's womb during a terrifying escape from war. The filmmakers allow the viewer to enter a virtual space and spend some intimate moments in the body of a child who may be born at any moment. Somewhere in the middle of the sea. Nowhere, and yet somewhere: on planet Earth.
Režisér: Gilles Porte, Nicolas Champeaux

Unique Theatrical Meetings of Yesterday's Film Heroes – This is the basis of the story that you will be guided through by someone who hasn't left the movies to this day. A little director, a bit of a ticket taker, a bit of a projectionist, a bit of a popcorn salesman, but especially an old friend to the now forgotten silver screen heroes – big, small, invisible, inventive, tender, and spooky. Their common stories will be accompanied by a pianist, just as it was during silent films. _Biograf_ is for lovers of cinemas of all ages.
Umělecké skupiny: Cirk La Putyka
Autor: Marek Zákostelecký, Jiří Kohout, František Karel Tománek
Režisér: Marek Zákostelecký, Jiří Kohout, František Karel Tománek

Světoznámé animační studio Pixar otevřelo v prostorách Křižíkova pavilonu E svou velkolepou výstavu. Putovní expozice se otevřela návštěvníkům v pátek, 15. února 2019 a její brány zůstanou otevřeny do 26. května. Výstava ukazuje základní principy tvorby animovaných filmů, návštěvníkům přibližuje, jakým způsobem vznikají filmy, které znají z pláten kin. Americké studio stojí za vznikem slavných filmů, jakými jsou Toy story, Auta, Ratatouille, Příšerky s. r. o, a mnoho dalších. Mezi nejzajímavější exponáty patří stroj Zoetrop, ve kterém ožijí modely postaviček filmu přímo před zraky návštěvníků. Zajímavé je také velkoplošné kino Artscape. Výstava bude otevřena každý den. Více informací o výstavě na www.pixarexhibition.cz

event_name: Seminář s tématem graffiti pro společenství vlastníků nebo bytová družstva
location: Úřad MČ Praha 7 (č. d. 225), Nábřeží Kapitána Jaroše 1000
description:
Od roku 2017 radnice pořádá tematicky zaměřené přednášky pro společenství vlastníků nebo bytová družstva. Po právním a technickém poradenství nyní přichází právě s tématem graffiti. Seminář se koná dne 11. března v budově Úřadu MČ Praha 7 (nábř. Kpt. Jaroše 1000, 2. patro, zasedací místnosti č. 225) od 17 hodin.

Na semináři se vystřídají přednášející z různých oborů (prevence, odstraňování graffiti apod.), v krátkých 30 min. blocích. Maximální délka semináře je 2 hodiny. Pokud bude velký zájem, seminář bude v budoucnu rozšířen. Přednášky jsou určeny především pro statutární zástupce společenství vlastníků a bytových družstev z Prahy 7.

Účast na seminářích je zdarma. Zúčastnit se mohou dvě osoby za společenství vlastníků nebo bytové družstvo. Z důvodu omezené kapacity je třeba předem zajistit rezervaci na emailu: gregorovaj@praha7.cz

event_name: Projekt Nejsi sám: Diskuze o sebevraždách mužů

description:
A light installation of geometric lines, in which the performer, choreographer and musician Stanislav Genadiev examines man's complex relationship to the outside world. Are we captured by events that influence our behaviour? Are things happening in the world intentionally, or are they just a quirk of serendipity? Genadiev interacts with hypnotic audio-visual effects and creates his own dance variation on C. G. Jung's theory of synchronicity. The performance will be followed up by the artist's DJ set, in which he uses his own recordings to intertwine UK bass, dub, breakbeat and jazz.
Umělecké skupiny: Genda

event_name: Exhibition Opening: Ve své slupce nikdy nenajdeš stání

description: Autor: Ine Ubben
Autor: Alica Minárová

A provocative, moralistic farce with an unusual and sophisticated narrative form. At the time of its original release the film was even the subject of questions in parliament. Two young girls - Marie I and Marie II - believe that "the world around them is spoiled" and therefore decide to be spoiled as well. Their key motto is: "Nothing matters, but good fun". They search for fun at home, at the swimming pool and in bars at night. Marie I meets an elderly gentleman and has dinner with him pretending to be modest and chaste. Then Marie II appears, sits down with the couple and shamelessly orders various kinds of delicacies. The girls finally take the surprised man to the railway station, put him in a train and emotionally wave him goodbye. They repeat this game several times, even with a young man who claims to be desperately in love with one of them. But all this is still not enough; the girls want to be even more spoiled…
Režisér: Věra Chytilová
Umělci: Jitka Cerhová, Ivana Karbanová, Julius Albert, Jan Klusák, Marie Češková, Marcela Březinová, Jiřina Myšková, Oldřich Hora, Václav Chochola, Jaromír Vomáčka, Josef Koníček, František Uldrich, Robert Kühnel, Oldřich Bašus
The exhibition will present contemporary work by Bina Ascher, who seeks inspiration in movement, landscape, and portraits.

This year the Cannes jury conferred Best Screenplay on the third picture from Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, who also turned heads on the French Riviera with Corpo Celeste and The Wonders. Addressing the question whether or not friendship can travel through time, Rohrwacher responds with a dreamlike story of kindhearted Lazzaro, who takes various adventures armed with an unshakable faith in human beings.

event_name: "I Do Not Care If We Go Down in History as Barbarians"
description:
A young artist is planning to reconstruct a historical event from 1941, during which the Romanian Administration through the Romanian Army carried out an ethnic massacre on the Eastern Front. One of contemporary Europe’s most distinctive creators has come out with an ingeniously conceived film that – although the topic unfolds slowly and in detail – hits the viewer with a singular emotional punch.
Režisér: Radu Jude
Umělci: Ioana Iacob, Alexandru Dabija

The ultra-funny mime and comedian Trygve Wakenshaw returns to Jatka78. His last show, _Trygve vs Baby_, tried to reveal who was funnier: a professional actor or a small child. He has collaborated with Thomas Monckton on _Cabaret Bears Costume_. Thomas's _Pianist_ and _The Artist_ are some of the most legendary performances that took place in Slaughterhouse78. In this new Trygve project, you will also meet other talented artists who will be invited to create something they have never done before, and will probably never do again. The performance concept is based on improvisation, so it never really happens that this show is always the same. You will never see some parts of the performance again, and others you may never want to.
Autor: Trygve Wakenshaw
Režisér: Trygve Wakenshaw
Umělci: Trygve Wakenshaw, Thomas Monckton

A modern black farce with an unexpected finale. For the first time, the Czech premiere of _Hard Sell_ hits the stage. Translated by Petr Čepek and directed by Filip Nuckolls, the text is altered to reflect post-revolutionary realities of the 1990s. _Two policemen, one corpse, and one witness. Is he culprit or victim? Why is he silent? A brilliant comedy about how much men of the law must use their imaginations in order to bring about justice. Can they manage it?_
Umělecké skupiny: Divadlo 6-16
Režisér: Filip Nuckolls
Umělci: Kryštof Rímský, Jan Jankovský, Jana Polášková

Unique Theatrical Meetings of Yesterday's Film Heroes – This is the basis of the story that you will be guided through by someone who hasn't left the movies to this day. A little director, a bit of a ticket taker, a bit of a projectionist, a bit of a popcorn salesman, but especially an old friend to the now forgotten silver screen heroes – big, small, invisible, inventive, tender, and spooky. Their common stories will be accompanied by a pianist, just as it was during silent films. _Biograf_ is for lovers of cinemas of all ages.
Umělecké skupiny: Cirk La Putyka
Autor: Marek Zákostelecký, Jiří Kohout, František Karel Tománek
Režisér: Marek Zákostelecký, Jiří Kohout, František Karel Tománek
Umělci: Jiří Kohout, Jan Čtvrtník

_What can keep you alive when the whole world stands against you?_ Ema Černá, child hero, the new production of Viktor Tauš, based on a true story, can eventually overcome this situation. The most essential part of the will to survive is true belief in oneself, the belief that somewhere, perhaps in America, someone waits who cares for you.

The most personal project to date from Academy Award (R)-winning director and writer Alfonso Cuarón (_Gravity, Children of Men, Y Tu Mama Tambien_), _Roma_ follows Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio), a young domestic worker for a family in the middle-class neighborhood of Roma in Mexico City. Delivering an artful love letter to the women who raised him, Cuarón draws on his own childhood to create a vivid and emotional portrait of domestic strife and social hierarchy amidst political turmoil of the 1970s.
Režisér: Alfonso Cuarón
Umělci: Yalitza Aparicio, Marina de Tavira, Diego Cortina Autrey, Carlos Peralta, Marco Graf, Daniela Demesa, Nancy García García, Verónica García, Andy Cortés, Fernando Grediaga, Jorge Antonio Guerrero

_A woodsy, erotic pantomime._ Love moves mountains, but passion makes of people ... what? Those who don’t want to flash with passion, should not go to the forest! A titilating comedy full of forest fruits and desirous animals. Based on the play by the famous actress and writer Isabella Andreini _La Mirtilla_ (1588), the first preserved pastoral by the female author's pen. The third part of the dramaturgical cycle _Opus Andreini_. *With English subtitles.*

description:
Asghar Farhadi’s eighth offering Everybody Knows, which opened this year’s festival in Cannes, is another of his films to illustrate the complexities of human relationships and their ultimate transformation. Laura, a Spanish woman living in Buenos Aires with her husband and children, hardly ever goes back to her native country. The events that unfold on her final visit there change everyone’s lives. A sharply honed family drama starring the outstanding Penélope Cruz and Javier Bardem.

This short film about life after the loss of a loved one deals with a difficult topic using techniques of both feature and animated film. The narrators' real experiences are combined with animated sequences that reconstruct painful situations while exploring the thoughts of three young people prematurely exposed to death.
Režisér: Diana Cam Van Nguyen

This year the Cannes jury conferred Best Screenplay on the third picture from Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, who also turned heads on the French Riviera with Corpo Celeste and The Wonders. Addressing the question whether or not friendship can travel through time, Rohrwacher responds with a dreamlike story of kindhearted Lazzaro, who takes various adventures armed with an unshakable faith in human beings.
Režisér: Alice Rohrwacher
Umělci: Adriano Tardiolo, Nicoletta Braschi, Sergi López, Alba Rohrwacher, Tommaso Ragno, Leonardo Nigro, Agnese Graziani, Luca Chikovani

description:

Režisér: Dean DeBlois
Umělci: Jay Baruchel, Kristen Wiig, T.J. Miller, Gerard Butler, Jonah Hill, Cate Blanchett, Djimon Hounsou, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, America Ferrera, Craig Ferguson

The most personal project to date from Academy Award (R)-winning director and writer Alfonso Cuarón (_Gravity, Children of Men, Y Tu Mama Tambien_), _Roma_ follows Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio), a young domestic worker for a family in the middle-class neighborhood of Roma in Mexico City. Delivering an artful love letter to the women who raised him, Cuarón draws on his own childhood to create a vivid and emotional portrait of domestic strife and social hierarchy amidst political turmoil of the 1970s.
Režisér: Alfonso Cuarón
Umělci: Yalitza Aparicio, Marina de Tavira, Diego Cortina Autrey, Carlos Peralta, Marco Graf, Daniela Demesa, Nancy García García, Verónica García, Andy Cortés, Fernando Grediaga, Jorge Antonio Guerrero

event_name: Master Class on Visual Style in Michael Haneke's Films
description:
In their master class, long time collaborators of Michael Haneke cinematographer Christian Berger and production designer Christoph Kanter will talk about the way they create the unique visual style in Haneke’s films. Berger and Kanter collaborated on five Haneke’s film – White Ribbon, The Piano Player, Benny’s Video, Hidden and 71 Fragments of a Chronology of Chance. Christian Berger, who was nominated for an Academy Award for his work on White Ribbon, will also talk about his unique lightning system called Cine Reflect. This system was based on lighting principles from industrial architecture and uses as much natural light as possible.

- 18. 3. / 3:45 PM Screening of a selected Michael Haneke’s film
- 18. 3. / 6:00 PM Master class with Christian Berger and Christopher Kanter

*Master class wil be held in English language.*

A 14-year-old video enthusiast is so caught up in film fantasy that he can no longer relate to the real world, to such an extent that he commits murder and records an on-camera confession for his parents.
Režisér: Michael Haneke
Umělci: Arno Frisch, Angela Winkler, Ulrich Mühe, Hanspeter Müller, Paulus Manker, Wolfgang Böck, Martin Schoendeling

Asghar Farhadi’s eighth offering Everybody Knows, which opened this year’s festival in Cannes, is another of his films to illustrate the complexities of human relationships and their ultimate transformation. Laura, a Spanish woman living in Buenos Aires with her husband and children, hardly ever goes back to her native country. The events that unfold on her final visit there change everyone’s lives. A sharply honed family drama starring the outstanding Penélope Cruz and Javier Bardem.
Režisér: Asghar Farhadi
Umělci: Javier Bardem, Penélope Cruz, Ricardo Darín, Bárbara Lennie, Inma Cuesta, Eduard Fernández, Elvira Mínguez, Roger Casamajor, Ramón Barea, Carla Campra

After promising 1100 employees that they would protect their jobs, the managers of a factory decide to suddenly close up shop. Laurent takes the lead in a fight against this decision. Malgré de lourds sacrifices financiers de la part des salariés et un bénéfice record de leur entreprise, la direction de l’usine Perrin Industrie décide néanmoins la fermeture totale du site. Accord bafoué, promesses non respectées, les 1100 salariés, emmenés par leur porte‑parole Laurent Amédéo, refusent cette décision brutale et vont tout tenter pour sauver leur emploi.
Režisér: Stéphane Brizé

Miruna, a 12-year-old Romanian girl, has no doubts about her future. She certainly does not plan to get married anytime soon and have lots of kids, like many of the girls in her neighbourhood. Her ambition is to become a cop. While the admission tests at the police academy will be far from easy, Miruna is determined to succeed and escape the socially excluded environment where she lives. Opportunities for quiet time to study in a home with 12 siblings may be scarce, but she is diligently trying to improve her grades. The only downside to her dream of the police academy is the knowledge that she will have less time to spend with her siblings, to whom she devotes herself every day.
Režisér: Heleen D'Haens, Eva van Barneveld

_The Queen's Corgi_ is about the adventure of Rex, the British monarch's most beloved dog, who loses track of his mistress and stumbles across a clan with dogs of all kinds confronting and fighting each other. During his epic journey to return to the queen, Rex falls in love and discovers his true self.
Režisér: Ben Stassen
Umělci: Julie Walters, Sheridan Smith, Ray Winstone, Jack Whitehall, Matt Lucas, Tom Courtenay, Colin McFarlane, Nina Wadia, Sarah Hadland, Kulvinder Ghir, Iain McKee, Anthony Skordi

Alfred ve dvoře, Františka Křížka 36, Praha 7
description:
_“An exceptionally suggestive audiovisual journey through a post-apocalyptic landscape.”_ _Tamura’s final journey. Volcanic gravel underfoot, the sun burning his back. The sound of his own shallow breathing is drowned out by irregular explosions somewhere in the distance. Wherever the eye looks, the landscape is scorched by the sun’s radiation and by the fires still burning on the plains. There is thick, choking smoke everywhere. Helplessness and desperation. And while the soldier Tamura is dying amidst this scene between war and environmental catastrophe, the viewer is encouraged to think and imagine and to become aware of the approaching apocalypse._ This performance, devised by Tereza Bartůňková, Jan Čtvrtník and co. follows loosely upon their previous project, _Dialogue_. They found inspiration for this new work in Japanese author Ooka Shohei’s novel _Fire on the Plain_. The performance creators paraphrase the dense storyline into a powerful audiovisual experience that is part radio play, part concert, and part comics. The sound, music, and visuals are created and mixed live, in real time, right on the stage. Tereza Bartůňková and Jan Čtvrtník are classmates from the Department of Alternative and Puppet Theatre at the Theatre Faculty of the Academy of Performing Arts in Prague (DAMU). They have collaborated on several previous theatre projects, including Korvína (Corvinus, 2013), Vítězný houpací kůň (The Victorious Rocking Horse, 2014), and Nekonečný příběh (The Neverending Story, 2015). Tereza creates the visuals, and Jan does the sound. The duo was brought together by their similar artistic way of thinking.
Autor: Tereza Bartůňková, Jan Čtvrtník
Umělci: Tereza Bartůňková, Michal Bednář, Jan Čtvrtník, Nataša Mikulová, Jan Nedbal

_12,000 litres of water, 1.5 tons of steel, 4 glass walls and 1 actress._ *After three years of preparation, which included working with stress analysts, glassmakers and water managers as well as challenging rehearsing in pools, Vít Neznal & Co. present a unique physical theater production.* _The world around us is constantly changing and we are forced to adapt. We cannot predict what happens tomorrow, in a week or in a month. We live in uncertainty, and in uncertainty, no one can be happy. Or can they?_ The play takes place in an aquarium in an otherwise unavailable industrial space and is created by the director Vít Neznal and a prominent Czech choreographer Dora Sulženko Hoštová in co-production with the festival _Letní Letná_ and the space Jatka78. The solo role is performed by the young actress and dancer Kateřina Dvořáková who was nominated for the Talent of the Year award in 2017. _“My goal here was to come up with a play inspired by what I've seen throughout the whole world - with dominant scenography which sets the tone for the whole production. The Unbearable Liquidity of Being is a story of a man who is struggling to come to terms with the uncertainty of today's world as well as the one of his own and trying to foresee the unforeseeable. A man, who must be ready for rain despite the clear forecast,”_ says Vít Neznal.
Autor: Vít Neznal, Kateřina Dvořáková
Režisér: Vít Neznal
Umělci: Kateřina Dvořáková

description:
*This years Crypto Camp will consist of seven days with ethical hackers in the city of Prague.*

In one week, they will lecture the attendants in the basics of cryptocurrencies, blockchain, digital security, darknet, 3D printing and electronics. Each participant will be equiped with the knowledge and tools to engage in an independent society and protect your liberty. Each day, you will have the opportunity to attend a lecture, workshop and evening movie screening focused on one of the themes. Besides studying, you will be served food by Bitcoin Coffee and have plenty of time for leisure activities and exploring Prague. The camp ends with a party and every participant receives a certificate of completion.

*The event will be held in English.*

Anka Langová – Od štěněte do pytle
location: Galerie na Úřadě MČ Praha 7, 2. patro, nábř. Kpt. Jaroše 1000
description:
Městská část Praha 7 vás srdečně zve na výstavu obrazů talentované umělkyně Anky Langové, která v Galerii na Miladě představí výběr svých prací s názvem Od štěněte do pytle. Tato svébytná mladá autorka je studentkou čtvrtého ročníku Akademie výtvarných umění v Praze v Ateliéru malířství u Josefa Bolfa a Jakuba Hoška.

Vernisáž výstavy se uskuteční ve čtvrtek 21. března 2019 v 16.30 hod. v Galerii na Miladě (Informační centrum Milady Horákové 2, Praha 7).

Výstava potrvá do 5. května 2019.

Vstup volný.

event_name: Veronika Lacinová – Cesta z temnoty mojí duše
location: budova Úřadu městské části Praha 7, nábř. Kpt. Jaroše 1000
description: Dubnová výstava obrazů Veroniky Lacinové s názvem Cesta z temnoty mojí duše představí nejen její tvorbu, ale i činnost neziskové organizace Fokus Praha. Ta pomáhá lidem s duševními problémy a nově sídlí v ulici Dukelských hrdinů 1. Sama autorka je členkou Skupiny F – výtvarníků se zkušeností s duševním onemocněním a sympatizujících tvůrců. Kromě obrazů se na výstavě dozvíte o současných trendech v oblasti duševního zdraví. Těšit se můžete také na autorské čtení z knihy Veroniky Lacinové, v níž zpracovává svoji zkušenost s psychickým onemocněním. Vernisáž za doprovodu pop-artové kapely Bruder Hans und Bruder Georg a s improvizací na klávesové nástroje od Bohumila Vernera se uskuteční 24. dubna od 17.30 hodin ve druhém patře radnice.

Radnice vás srdečně zve na jarní koncert, jenž bude připomínkou 60. výročí úmrtí skladatele Bohuslava Martinů. Koncert se uskuteční v úterý 30. dubna od 19.30 hodin v kostele sv. Antonína na Strossmayerově náměstí. V podání Piccolo coro & Piccola orchestra a ansámblů Pedagogické fakulty Univerzity Karlovy zazní Čtyři písně o Marii, Otvírání studánek a Kytice.

Vstup zdarma.

event_name: Vzpomínkový akt – Památka padlých z květnového povstání 1945
description: Památku padlých z květnového povstání 1945 uctí vzpomínkový akt v úpatí mostu Barikádníků v ulici Povltavská v pátek 3. května v 9 hodin. Dopravní spojení je linkou 112 ze zastávky Nádraží Holešovice do zastávky Pelc-Tyrolka.

Veřejné šachové stolky na Řezáčově náměstí a v parčíku v Tusarově ožijí 17. dubna od 16 do 18 hodin dalším ročníkem šachového turnaje. Hrát se bude na obou místech paralelně, registrace účastníků je v 15.30 hodin. Každý z turnajů je určen maximálně pro 16 hráčů a jedno utkání trvá 2x 5 minut. Velké finále se uskuteční v 17.30 hodin na Řezáčově náměstí a v 18 hodin se už můžete těšit na vyhlášení vítěze. Kdo se letos stane králem šachistů Sedmičky?

Srdečně vás zveme na setkání ve čtvrtek 11. dubna od 18 hodin v Restaurace Na Manince, Jateční 540/4, které je součástí oblíbeného cyklu neformálních posezení se starostou Janem Čižinským a dalšími radními Prahy 7 v sedmičkových hospůdkách a kavárnách. Opět se budete moci vedení městské části ptát na to, co vás zajímá, nebo jim sdělit, co máte na srdci. Kromě starosty se na vás bude těšit také radní pro sociální a zdravotní politiku a národnostní menšiny Jakob Hurrle.

Jaké to je běhat noční Stromovkou, si můžete vyzkoušet na dalším ročníku charitativní akce Nadačního fondu Českého rozhlasu Světluška. Akce se uskuteční ve čtvrtek 11. dubna ve Stromovce, zapisovat se můžete již od 18.30 hodin. Samotnému běhu, který odstartuje ve 21 hodin, bude předcházet koncert kapely Pekař. Chybět nebudou ani nevidomí maséři a fotokoutek. Startovným, které v předprodeji činí 450 Kč, přispějete na pomoc lidem s vážným zrakovým postižením. Kromě dobrého pocitu a jedinečného zážitku dostanou včas registrovaní účastníci startovní balíček s čelovkou, běžeckou termofólií a plátěný sportovní vak.

www.behprosvetlusku.cz

Dům dětí a mládeže Prahy 7 připravil pro děti na začátek jara zábavné soutěžní odpoledne ve vodárenské věži. Budete si moci uplést pomlázku a vypůjčit si šlapací motokáry. K vidění budou také živá zvířata. Na stanovištích dále naleznete střelnici, výtvarnou dílničku, pekárnu a puzzle. Akce probíhá v neděli 7. dubna od 13 do 17 hodin a je zdarma.

www.ddmpraha7.cz

V rámci celorepublikové akce Ukliďme svět, ukliďme Česko se i vy na Sedmičce můžete podílet na tom, aby byla naše čtvrť čistší a hezčí. Sraz dobrovolníků bude v sobotu 6. dubna v 9 hodin na Strossmayerově náměstí. Těšit se můžete nejen na skvělý pocit ze záslužné práce, ale i na drobnou odměnu. Každoroční akce v ČR probíhá od roku 1992, loni se po celé zemi zapojilo 134 854 dobrovolníků a bylo odklizeno 2113 tun odpadu.

www.uklidmecesko.cz

Již třetí ročník festivalu dramatických kroužků a všech amatérských malých herců ze Sedmičky se uskuteční ve čtvrtek 25. dubna v aule ZŠ T. G. Masaryka na Ortenově náměstí od 9 do 15 hodin. Osloveny byly děti z mateřských a základních škol v Praze 7, aby okusily prkna, co znamenají svět, a vzájemně se inspirovaly. V porotě zasednou profesionální herci, zástupci radnice a učitelé. Do publika jsou zváni rodiče, kamarádi, spolužáci i široká veřejnost.

www.zstgm7.cz

260. výročí úmrtí skladatele Georga Friedricha Händela si připomene Česká Händelova společnost seminářem, který se uskuteční 24. dubna od 18 hodin v učebně č. 16 ve Vyšší odborné škole oděvního návrhářství a Střední průmyslové škole oděvní v ulici Jablonského 3. Zaměří se na poslední desetiletí skladatelova života, zejména s ohledem na jeho oční chorobu.

Vstup je zdarma.

Již poosmé změří své síly malí i ti nejmenší na koloběžkách a odrážedlech. Závod v režii slavné komiksové čtyřky se uskuteční 27. dubna od 10 do 18 hodin ve Stromovce. Z důvodu rekonstrukce Šlechtovky bude závod probíhat v prostoru pod planetáriem. K účasti v závodu je povinná helma. Součástí akce je i doprovodný program – výtvarné dílny, malování na obličej, skákací hrad a další. Vstup zdarma, startovné 190 Kč.

www.divadlovparku.cz

V sobotu 6. dubna se v Praze uskuteční již tradiční Sportisimo 1/2Maraton Praha, který odstartuje v 10 hodin dopoledne z náměstí Jana Palacha. Kromě možnosti přijít sledovat hvězdy světového běhu, které svojí účastí podpoří činnost charitativních organizací, přinese akce také několik uzavírek.

Velká část její trasy povede totiž přes nábřeží Edvarda Beneše, Kpt. Jaroše a Bubenské nábřeží. Dále pak ulicemi Komunardů, Jateční a Jankovcovou na Libeňský most. Je tedy třeba počítat s uzavřením uvedených komunikací pro dopravu po celou dobu závodu (do cca 13 hodin). Bezplatná dopravně-informační linka 800 165 102 funguje od 1. dubna od 9 do 18 hodin, v den závodu bude v provozu do 14 hodin i další informační linka: 800 100 991. 

www.runczech.com

Pražské kolo Juniorského maratonu se koná 15. 4. 2019 v parku Stromovka.

Juniorský maraton je největší běžeckou akcí pro střední školy v České republice. Běží se formou štafety desetičlenných družstev složených ze středoškolských studentů, kteří společně zdolávají maratonskou trať (42,195 km). Soutěž o nejlepší běžeckou školu se koná v každém krajském městě. Ty nejlepší týmy postoupí do finále, které se bude konat v rámci prestižního mezinárodního Volkswagen Maratonu Praha 5. května 2019.

Již nyní se můžete registrovat na www.runczech.com/jmc

Dejte dohromady Váš školní tým a poběžte o titul Nejrychlejší střední škola v Praze!

_Rascals Drink'n'Draw_ is an event mainly for videogames or film professionals and art students who would like to get better in their craft. Under our Art Director guidance you would be able to try out different poses, lighting exercises and time-stamped "shorts" for quick sketches. And if you tire of drawing and sketching you can always exchange tips and news with others over some good beer or wine!

The most personal project to date from Academy Award (R)-winning director and writer Alfonso Cuarón (_Gravity, Children of Men, Y Tu Mama Tambien_), _Roma_ follows Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio), a young domestic worker for a family in the middle-class neighborhood of Roma in Mexico City. Delivering an artful love letter to the women who raised him, Cuarón draws on his own childhood to create a vivid and emotional portrait of domestic strife and social hierarchy amidst political turmoil of the 1970s.
Režisér: Alfonso Cuarón
Umělci: Yalitza Aparicio, Marina de Tavira, Diego Cortina Autrey, Carlos Peralta, Marco Graf, Daniela Demesa, Nancy García García, Verónica García, Andy Cortés, Fernando Grediaga, Jorge Antonio Guerrero

Asghar Farhadi’s eighth offering Everybody Knows, which opened this year’s festival in Cannes, is another of his films to illustrate the complexities of human relationships and their ultimate transformation. Laura, a Spanish woman living in Buenos Aires with her husband and children, hardly ever goes back to her native country. The events that unfold on her final visit there change everyone’s lives. A sharply honed family drama starring the outstanding Penélope Cruz and Javier Bardem.
Režisér: Asghar Farhadi
Umělci: Javier Bardem, Penélope Cruz, Ricardo Darín, Bárbara Lennie, Inma Cuesta, Eduard Fernández, Elvira Mínguez, Roger Casamajor, Ramón Barea, Carla Campra

This year the Cannes jury conferred Best Screenplay on the third picture from Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, who also turned heads on the French Riviera with Corpo Celeste and The Wonders. Addressing the question whether or not friendship can travel through time, Rohrwacher responds with a dreamlike story of kindhearted Lazzaro, who takes various adventures armed with an unshakable faith in human beings.
Režisér: Alice Rohrwacher
Umělci: Adriano Tardiolo, Nicoletta Braschi, Sergi López, Alba Rohrwacher, Tommaso Ragno, Leonardo Nigro, Agnese Graziani, Luca Chikovani

A 90-year-old horticulturist and Korean War veteran is caught transporting $3 million worth of cocaine through Illinois for a Mexican drug cartel.
Režisér: Clint Eastwood
Umělci: Clint Eastwood, Bradley Cooper, Dianne Wiest, Taissa Farmiga, Michael Peña, Alison Eastwood, Andy Garcia, Laurence Fishburne, Clifton Collins Jr., Robert LaSardo, Noel Gugliemi, Katie Gill, Ignacio Serricchio, Lobo Sebastian, Loren Dean, Victor Rasuk, Pete Burris

Aïlo: an odyssey in Lapland tells the fight for the survival of a small wild reindeer, frail and vulnerable to the challenges that punctuate his first year. Its awakening to the wild world is a real tale in the heart of the grandiose landscapes of Lapland.
Režisér: Guillaume Maidatchevsky
Umělci: Peter Franzén ( vyp.)

_The Queen's Corgi_ is about the adventure of Rex, the British monarch's most beloved dog, who loses track of his mistress and stumbles across a clan with dogs of all kinds confronting and fighting each other. During his epic journey to return to the queen, Rex falls in love and discovers his true self.
Režisér: Ben Stassen
Umělci: Julie Walters, Sheridan Smith, Ray Winstone, Jack Whitehall, Matt Lucas, Tom Courtenay, Colin McFarlane, Nina Wadia, Sarah Hadland, Kulvinder Ghir, Iain McKee, Anthony Skordi

Maker Faire je největší světová přehlídka inovací, kreativity a důmyslnosti pro celou rodinu. Je to přátelské setkání tvořivých a zvídavých lidí, které baví zkoušet nové věci a sdílet své poznatky a zkušenosti. Je to částečně zábavný jarmark, ale také veletrh pro makery všech generací. Maker Faire se otevírá inženýrům, řemeslníkům, umělcům, kutilům, zahradníkům i vědcům. Je to místo, kde každý může ukázat svůj koníček, vychytávku, hack, experiment nebo projekt. Maker Faire zkrátka nabízí možnost nejen nahlédnout do budoucnosti, ale také se na ní podílet.

Maker Faire ukazuje současný svět elektroniky jako přístupný, zábavný a kreativní, blízký jak dětem, tak rodičům nebo prarodičům hledajícím aktivní zábavu, užitečné dovednosti a nové nápady. Tento globální festival digitálního i analogového, tradičního i technického kutilství pro celou rodinu se poprvé konal v roce 2006 v San Franciscu. V loňském roce na pražský festival dorazilo 10 000 návštěvníků a ukázalo se 200 vystavujících, kteří zde vystavují zadarmo.

Autor: Hans Christian Andersen, Natálie Preslová
Režisér: Jiří Hajdyla
Umělci: Vera Hejková, Sára Šimunovičová, Nikki Böjtösová, Anna Břenková a Václav Hoskovec

The first festival of Diáky ever brings unique journeys of eleven well-known personalities. Some of them traveled by foot, others hitchhiked trains or boats, some chose non-standard means of transport. But all of them were able to “get out” and left their daily routine behind.

This year the Cannes jury conferred Best Screenplay on the third picture from Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, who also turned heads on the French Riviera with Corpo Celeste and The Wonders. Addressing the question whether or not friendship can travel through time, Rohrwacher responds with a dreamlike story of kindhearted Lazzaro, who takes various adventures armed with an unshakable faith in human beings.
Režisér: Alice Rohrwacher

The most personal project to date from Academy Award (R)-winning director and writer Alfonso Cuarón (_Gravity, Children of Men, Y Tu Mama Tambien_), _Roma_ follows Cleo (Yalitza Aparicio), a young domestic worker for a family in the middle-class neighborhood of Roma in Mexico City. Delivering an artful love letter to the women who raised him, Cuarón draws on his own childhood to create a vivid and emotional portrait of domestic strife and social hierarchy amidst political turmoil of the 1970s.
Režisér: Alfonso Cuarón
Umělci: Yalitza Aparicio, Marina de Tavira, Diego Cortina Autrey, Carlos Peralta, Marco Graf, Daniela Demesa, Nancy García García, Verónica García, Andy Cortés, Fernando Grediaga, Jorge Antonio Guerrero
